abstract.p: Common Council in White Plains, NY, postpones decision on proposed rezoning of downtown parcel for commercial and residential development by New York Presbyterian Hospital in exchange for giving 60 acres of parkland to city (S)

block.p: The White Plains Common Council has postponed a decision on proposed land development by New York Presbyterian Hospital. The hospital wants commercial and residential development on portions of its 121-acre downtown property in exchange for giving 60 acres of parkland to the city, a plan that only two of the seven Council members support. The hospital had asked for rezoning for the development. At a meeting last week, one of the supporters, Mayor Joseph M. Delfino, asked the Council to postpone a decision until Monday, so he could try to work out a compromise.
